business.headline: Health insurance in 2025: Key traps that could drain your pocketClauses such as room rent caps, deductibles, and co-pay options are often buried deep in policy documents but can have a massive influence on the claim process.

OpenAI hits $500 billion mark as SoftBank, others buy shares: ReportThe latest valuation marks a sharp rise from the company's previous valuation of $300 billion and highlights how quickly OpenAI's value has grown as demand for artificial intelligence tools continues to rise.

entertainment.headline: Boney Kapoor says Khushi got 100% scholarship from New York Film Academy Film producer Boney Kapoor recently shared that his actor-daughter Khushi Kapoor secured a 100% scholarship to the New York Film Academy. He said Khushi secured the scholarship based on her audition tape.

Why OTT reminds of Doordarshan of the eighties and nineties (and in a good way) In recent years, streaming platforms have emerged as launchpads for actors young and old who were struggling for a break in films, much like Doordarshan in the eighties and nineties. IndiaToday.in analyses the parallels.

Yash, Upendra praise Rishab Shetty's Kantara: Chapter 1 for raising the bar Rishab Shetty's Kantara Chapter 1 was released on October 3, 2025. Actor Yash praised the film in his X review called it a "truly immersive experience on screen."

Bhagwat Chapter One trailer: Jitendra Kumar sheds good guy image in crime thriller The trailer of Bhagwat Chapter One Raakshas starring Arshad Warsi and Jitendra Kumar is released ahead of its Zee5 premiere on October 17. The Ba***ds of Bollywood trends globally; Aryan Khan reflects on challenges, joy Aryan Khan's 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' is trending globally. Amid the success, the director reflected on the challenges and joy of shooting the series.

Cillian Murphy's Peaky Blinders confirmed for two new seasons Cillian Murphy's historical crime drama 'Peaky Blinders' will be back with two new seasons on Netflix, following the franchise film 'The Immortal Man', which is slated to release in 2026.

Sahher Bamba recalls meeting Shah Rukh Khan, praises Gauri Khan Sahher Bamba shares her memorable experience meeting Shah Rukh Khan and Gauri Khan. She highlights the warmth and motherly care shown by Gauri Khan on the sets of 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'.

Neeraj Ghaywan reacts to reports of paying less compensation to Homebound family Director Neeraj Ghaywan reacted to reports of paying less compensation to the family on whom 'Homebound' is based.  The filmmaker set the record straight with his post on social media.

Sharvari begins shooting for Imtiaz Ali's next, wishes Dussehra with special note Bollywood actor Sharvari has begun shooting her next film with acclaimed director Imtiaz Ali, co-starring Vedang Raina, marking the start of the project on Dussehra with a special puja.

Over 1,000 users reported issues, highlighting the significant demand for the pop star's latest work.

Cinematic thunderstorm: Prabhas, Sandeep Vanga shower praise on Kantara Chapter 1 Actor Prabhas and director Sandeep Reddy Vanga were blown away by Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1'. While Prabhas called the film brilliant, Sandeep praised the film as a cinematic thunderstorm.

general news.headline: TVK abandoned stampede site, reflects leader's mindset: High Court blasts VijayThe Madras High Court criticised TVK leaders over the Karur stampede, accusing party chief Vijay of fleeing the scene. The court also ordered formation of a Special Investigation Team to probe the case.

Hardly any worries for India as Ravindra Jadeja is also looking for a three-figure score.

Pakistan Army is a mercenary force, once butchered 25,000 PalestiniansFrom the 1970 Black September in Jordan when Pakistani troops under Zia-Ul-Haq's command butchered 25,000 Palestinians, to the brand-new defence pact with Riyadh, Pakistan's generals have long fought for whoever signs the biggest cheques. The latest deal with Saudi Arabia, with a promise of a nuclear shield, is the latest chapter in Rawalpindi's long mercenary ledger.

English didn't rule India: Musk-shared post slammed for whitewashing pastTech tycoon Elon Musk faced backlash after sharing white supremacist Stefan Molyneux's post denying British colonisation of India. Critics, including Indians, accused the supremacist for enabling historical whitewashing by denying British colonialism. Historians and commentators pointed to the immense human and economic toll of colonialism. Such denials are as dangerous as Holocaust revisionism.

Mahindra's iconic off-roader gets better: Here's what's newMahindra has launched the new Thar facelift in India, starting at Rs 9.99 lah (ex-showroom), featuring refreshed styling, upgraded interiors, advanced tech, and enhanced off-road capability while retaining its rugged lifestyle SUV appeal.

Apple Watch Ultra saves life of 26-year-old Mumbai techie after scuba diving accidentThe robust health and environment tracking in devices like Apple Watch can prove to be life-saving. As the Apple Watch Ultra recently did in the case of Kshitij Zodape, a Mumbai resident who was scuba diving in Puducherry a few months ago.

In Balochistan, where Dussehra was once homeDussehra in Balochistan (A province in Pakistan) – this may seem unreal now, but in the 1920s, during colonial rule, the region witnessed the burning of Ravana's effigies year after year. The popular festival brought the Hindu community together in a spirit of cohesiveness. It wasn't just Balochistan. Records show that Dussehra was celebrated widely in other parts of present-day Pakistan too. From Lahore to Sindh, the festival was popular and vibrant. Let's take a dive into this once-popular tradition in the history of Balochistan.

sports.headline: Ravindra Jadeja emulates Kapil Dev, Imran Khan with sixth Test hundred Ravindra Jadeja joined the legendary duo of Kapil Dev and Imran Khan after racking up his sixth ODI hundred in the opening Test against the West Indies at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

His 190-ball effort showcased his skill, temperament, and ability to perform as a top or middle-order batter.

West Indies greats list reform roadmap after 27 all out humiliation vs Australia Cricket West Indies (CWI) announced immediate and long-term structural measures to address on-field struggles and revive cricket development across the Caribbean, following input from legendary figures and current stakeholders.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
